form.name: form1

div.span: All Day Closure

span.div: Due to the threat of Coronavirus, the Bethel Park School District is CLOSED through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

div.div: MISSION: To lead an educational partnership with the Community, maintaining an environment that challenges all students to reach their potential as lifelong learners and responsible members of society.

div.div: Welcome to the Bethel Park School District

a.title: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

img.title: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year
img.alt: Schools Closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

h3.a: BPSD Closure Information

div.span: Due to the spread of the Coronavirus, the Bethel Park School District will be closed until further notice. This page was updated on Tuesday, April 14.

h3.a: Continuity Of Education Program

div.span: The Bethel Park School District's Continuity of Education Program will continue through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Please click here to see the Program for the Fourth Quarter.

h3.a: Coronavirus Information

div.span: Please click here to learn more about the Coronavirus from various health organizations.

h3.a: April 21 School Board Meeting

div.span: The Bethel Park Board of School Directors will hold a Regular Voting Meeting, followed by its April Committee Meeting, using a virtual format on April 21. Please click here to learn how you can watch the meetings.

h3.a: Changes To The 2019-2020 School Calendar

div.span: Please click here to see the changes to the 2019-2020 school calendar.

h3.a: Video Messages From The Bethel Park School District

div.span: Please click here to see some video messages from the employees of the Bethel Park School District. #BPProud

h3.a: BPHS Students Win Two Awards At Science Olympiad

div.span: Bethel Park High School students won two awards at the Science Olympiad.

h3.a: IMS Students Finish In Second In Science Bowl

div.span: A team of Independence Middle School students finished in Second Place in their Division at the Southwestern PA Science Bowl.

h3.a: Five Students Named Top Of The Shop

div.span: Five Bethel Park High School students were named Top of the Shop by Steel Center for the First Semester.

h3.a: Three Musicians Selected For Region Band

div.span: Three Bethel Park High School musicians were selected to play in the PMEA Region Band.

h3.a: Five BPHS Students Recognized For Work On National Latin Exams

div.span: Five Bethel Park High School students were recognized for their high scores on the National Latin Exams.

h3.a: District Hires Interim Superintendent

div.span: The Bethel Park School District hired Dr. Joseph Dimperio as its Interim Superintendent.

img.title: The Design Lives Here Second Place Team

h3.a: IMS Students Take Second Place In Design Challenge

div.span: Three Independence Middle School students earned Second Place at the WQED Design Lives Here Competition.

h3.a: BPHS Students Win Three Awards At Catapult Competiton

div.span: Bethel Park High School students earned three awards at a catapult competition held at Shaler High School.

h3.a: Five Vocalists Selected For All-State Chorus

div.span: Five Bethel Park High School vocalists have been selected to perform in the PMEA All-State Chorus!

h3.a: Memorial Students Win Local Odyssey Of The Mind Division I Championship

div.span: Congratulations to the team of Memorial Elementary students who won the local Odyssey of the Mind Division I Championship!

a.title: The three Gold Award winning students

img.title: The three Gold Award winning students
img.alt: The three Gold Award winning students

h3.a: BPHS Students Earn 20 Awards On National German Exams

div.span: Bethel Park High School students earned 20 awards on the 2020 National German Exams.

h3.a: Bethel Park High School Students Win 25 Awards At DECA State Conference

div.span: Bethel Park High School students won 25 awards at the DECA State Career Development Conference.

a.title: The students and teachers involved with the Blood Drives

img.alt: The students and teachers involved with the Blood Drives

h3.a: Bethel Park High School Selected To Receive National Blood Drive Award

div.span: Bethel Park High School has been selected to receive the National School Blood Drive Award from the Association of Donor Relations Professionals.

h3.a: Fourth Graders Finish In Fourth Place At Elementary Science Bowl

div.span: A team of Bethel Park fourth grade students finished in Fourth Place at the Elementary Science Bowl.

Removal of any material or graphic images without written consent from the Bethel Park School District may be subject to prosecution. The illegal use of copyrighted software by students and staff is prohibited. Any data uploaded to or downloaded from district systems shall be subject to fair use guidelines. Any original work created for use within the district shall remain under the ownership of the Bethel Park School District. If you believe content posted on the website violates copyright laws, please email [email protected] The district does not have any Title I served school buildings in School Improvement.
